game

Class EasyGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.Screen
      • game.LevelScreen
        • game.EasyGame

  • public class EasyGame
extends LevelScreen
    The EasyGame class is a screen that represents the Easy Level. The gameplay involves shooting stable atoms at stable atoms or neutrons at unstable atoms. The first interaction simulates nuclear fusion, and the second simulates nuclear fission. There are an equal number of both reactions. There are no obstacles.
    Version:
    1.0, May 21 2014. (extends panel, uses paintComponent), 1.1, May 22 2014. (extends levelscreen, updates!), 1.2, May 26 2014. (Modified all code involving 'player' to fit changes to LevelScreen.), 1.3, May 27 2014. (Modified code for updating the inventory and targets. Actually shoots and interacts! + comment lines), 1.4, May 28 2014. (Temporary code to print points in the interactions pane.), 1.5, May 29 2014. (JavaDoc, removed KeyOverrides method - was protected, don't know what it does), 1.6, May 31 2014. (Creates equal number of stable and unstable so game is winnable, creates full inventory, added win/lose methods), 1.7, June 2 2014. (More JavaDoc), 1.8, June 3 2014. (Modifications due to location class constructor change, removes instead of sets location to null, two keys at once), 1.9, June 4 2014. (Modified win and lose screens, once a player wins, they will be taken to the next level), 1.10, June 5 2014. (Sends tempPoints to super, JavaDoc is current), 2.0, June 8 2014. (Displays facts.), 2.1, June 10 2014. (JavaDoc)
    Author:
    Anqi Wu, Chusa Nguyen

    • Constructor Detail

      • EasyGame

        public EasyGame(ScreenFactory screenFactory)
        Creates a new screen that represents the easy level. It creates a random list of targets and user inventory.
        Parameters:
        screenFactory - - ScreenFactory - The ScreenFactory object that stores the current screen.
        newTargets - - ArrayList - The new list of targets.
        newInventory - - ArrayList - The new list of inventory particles.
        name - - String - Temporarily stores the names of the elements to create.
        count - - int - Stores the number of unstable or neutrons elements.
        count2 - - int - Stores the number of stable elements.
        row - - int - Stores the current row.
        col - - int - Stores the current column.

    • Method Detail

      • onCreate

        public void onCreate()
        Empty override from the Screen class.
        Specified by:
        onCreate in class LevelScreen

      • onUpdate

        public void onUpdate()
        First, the player and shooting is updated. Then, target-inventory interaction is updated. If there is any target directly infront of an inventory particle, interaction has occurred. Either both are removed or only one is removed, depending on whether the user shot at the correct target. Points are also updated. Finally, all elements with no locations are removed, and all elements are updated.
        Specified by:
        onUpdate in class LevelScreen
        Parameters:
        x - - int - Increments through for loop.
        inv - - GameParticle - Stores the temporary inventory elements.
        tar - - GameParticle - Stores the temporary target elements.
        index - - int - Stores the index of the target in the same location as the current inventory.

      • onDraw

        public void onDraw(java.awt.Graphics2D twoDimensional)
        Displays the easy level on the JPanel. It draws the wallpaper, tutorial, player (launcher), inventory, targets and win/lose screen, respectively. If the inventory and targets are all removed, and the game has not been won before, the win screen is displayed. Otherwise, if only the inventory is used up, the gameOver screen is displayed.
        Overrides:
        onDraw in class LevelScreen
        Parameters:
        twoDimensional - - Graphics2D - The Graphics2D object.
        x - - int - Increments through for loop.
